body:
@jaelynlitz Thanks for reporting this issue! Have you checked the tracking server logs? When an internal server error occurs, the server usually generates logs that look like this:

```
[2022-07-27 11:18:50 +0900] [62087] [DEBUG] POST /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/runs/search
2022/07/27 11:18:50 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/runs/search [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2070, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1515, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1513, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1499, in dispatch_request
    return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**req.view_args)
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 454, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 512, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 858, in _search_runs
    experiment_ids, filter_string, run_view_type, max_results, order_by, page_token
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/abstract_store.py", line 294, in search_runs
    experiment_ids, filter_string, run_view_type, max_results, order_by, page_token
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 1097, in _search_runs
    raise Exception("Unexpected error")
Exception: Unexpected error
```

`Error: Promised response from onMessage listener went out of scope 5 [background.js:841:170](moz-extension://d6a7add6-de11-4239-898f-0a287b30c3e7/dist/background.js)` is unrelated to MLflow. I think this comes from a chrome extension.

Thanks for the quick response @harupy! I found the logs you're looking for:

```
> WARNING:root:Malformed run '14c113ff02da4f5b9125a70482316277'. Detailed error Yaml file '/data/data/5/14c113ff02da4f5b9125a70482316277/meta.yaml' does not exist.
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 606, in _list_run_infos
>     run_info = self._get_run_info_from_dir(r_dir)
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 450, in _get_run_info_from_dir
>     meta = read_yaml(run_dir, FileStore.META_DATA_FILE_NAME)
>   File "/app/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 167, in read_yaml
>     raise MissingConfigException("Yaml file '%s' does not exist." % file_path)
> mlflow.exceptions.MissingConfigException: Yaml file '/data/data/5/14c113ff02da4f5b9125a70482316277/meta.yaml' does not exist.

> 2022/07/27 19:03:31 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/runs/search [POST]
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2447, in wsgi_app
>     response = self.full_dispatch_request()
>   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1952, in full_dispatch_request
>     rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
>   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1821, in handle_user_exception
>     reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
>   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/_compat.py", line 39, in reraise
>     raise value
>   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1950, in full_dispatch_request
>     rv = self.dispatch_request()
>   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1936, in dispatch_request
>     return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
>   File "/app/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 155, in wrapper
>     return func(*args, **kwargs)
>   File "/app/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 394, in _search_runs
>     max_results, order_by, page_token)
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/abstract_store.py", line 230, in search_runs
>     order_by, page_token)
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 631, in _search_runs
>     run_infos = self._list_run_infos(experiment_id, run_view_type)
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 606, in _list_run_infos
>     run_info = self._get_run_info_from_dir(r_dir)
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 451, in _get_run_info_from_dir
>     run_info = _read_persisted_run_info_dict(meta)
>   File "/app/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 69, in _read_persisted_run_info_dict
>     dict_copy = run_info_dict.copy()
> AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'copy'
```

Hi @jaelynlitz, are you deleting runs permanently using [mlflow gc](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/cli.html#mlflow-gc), or are you soft-deleting them using MLflow's [delete_run](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/cli.html#mlflow-gc) API / UI?
@dbczumar I was deleting runs using the UI (so I'd check the boxes then hit the delete button)

Got it. The `mlflow.exceptions.MissingConfigException: Yaml file '/data/data/5/14c113ff02da4f5b9125a70482316277/meta.yaml' does not exist.` excerpt from the error message seems to indicate the metadata file associated with the run has been deleted. However, deletion through the UI doesn't actually remove run files, it just writes a `lifecycle_stage: deleted` line to the metadata file. Is anyone else in your organization using `mlflow gc` or manually removing files from the `mlruns` directory?

@jaelynlitz @dbczumar  The stack trace indicates `read_yaml` in `_get_run_info_from_dir` returns `None`:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/56698a23f5996e1d6b605cd714a5917434adeb9b/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py#L449-L451

(Note this is the code in MLflow 1.10.0)

`read_yaml` returns `None` when the file `{run_dir}/{FileStore.META_DATA_FILE_NAME}` exists, but it's empty.

During `delete_run`, `meta.yaml` is opened with the `w` mode to update `lifecycle_stage` to `deleted` and becomes empty for a moment:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/56698a23f5996e1d6b605cd714a5917434adeb9b/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py#L741

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/56698a23f5996e1d6b605cd714a5917434adeb9b/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py#L143-L147

If the read occurs before `yaml.dump` completes, it might cause the error.

This might not be what's really happening but we can reproduce the error with this script: ```python # Before running this script: log some runs using the file store and launch MLflow UI import time path = "mlruns/0/f18249d1f76d445f8324550a74c0d07b/meta.yaml" with open(path, "r") as f: a = f.read() with open(path, "w") as f: print("Fetch some runs on MLflow UI") time.sleep(10) f.write(a) ``` ### UI ### Tracking server log ``` 2022/07/28 21:36:08 ERROR mlflow.server: Exception on /ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/runs/search [POST] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2070, in wsgi_app response = self.full_dispatch_request() File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1515, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.handle_user_exception(e) File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1513, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.dispatch_request() File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1499, in dispatch_request return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**req.view_args) File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 454, in wrapper return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 512, in wrapper return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 858, in _search_runs experiment_ids, filter_string, run_view_type, max_results, order_by, page_token File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/abstract_store.py", line 294, in search_runs experiment_ids, filter_string, run_view_type, max_results, order_by, page_token File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 809, in _search_runs run_infos = self._list_run_infos(experiment_id, run_view_type) File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 777, in _list_run_infos run_info = self._get_run_info_from_dir(r_dir) File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 610, in _get_run_info_from_dir run_info = _read_persisted_run_info_dict(meta) File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/store/tracking/file_store.py", line 112, in _read_persisted_run_info_dict dict_copy = run_info_dict.copy() AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'copy' ```
@dbczumar I doubt any of our other users are using the `mlflow gc` command or touching the mlruns directory. We mainly interact with mlflow by logging runs through code, then looking through the UI.

@jaelynlitz Thank you for clarifying. @harupy awesome investigation! I'm inclined to believe that the race condition noted by @harupy is the cause of transient `SearchRuns` API request errors that cause UI failures. I will investigate a fix. Note that this also impacts operations that update the run's `meta.yaml` file, such as `end_run()`
